tool.name: HyPhy-BGM
tool.description: - Detecting coevolving sites via Bayesian graphical models

param.name: model
param.label: Substitution model
param.option: LG - Generalist empirical model from Le and Gascuel (2008)
HIVBm - Specialist empirical model for between-host HIV sequences
HIVWm - Specialist empirical model for within-host HIV sequences
WAG - Generalist empirical model from Whelan and Goldman (2001)
JTT - Generalist empirical model from Jones, Taylor, and Thornton (1996)
JC69 - Generalist empirical model from with equal exchangeability rates
mtMet - Specialist empirical model for metazoan mitochondrial genomes
mtVer - Specialist empirical model for vertebrate mitochondrial genomes
mtInv - Specialist empirical model for invertebrate mitochondrial genomes
gcpREV - Specialist empirical model for green plant chloroplast genomes

param.name: gencodeid
param.label: Genetic code
param.option: Mold, Protozoan and Coelenterate mt; Mycloplasma/Spiroplasma
Ciliate, Dasycladacean and Hexamita Nuclear code

param.name: branch_subset
param.label: Subset of branches to include substitutions from

param.name: burn_in
param.label: Number of samples to discard for burn-in

param.name: sample
param.label: Number of steps to extract from chain sample

param.name: parents
param.label: Maximum number of parents allowed per node

param.name: min_subs
param.label: Minimum number of ubstitutions per site to be included in the analysis

tool.help: BGM (Bayesian Graphical Models) reconstructs the substitution history of the alignment by maximum likelihood-based phylogenetic methods, and then analyzes the joint distribution of substitution events using Bayesian graphical models to identify significant associations among sites.
